editionStmt.p: The initial version of this file was created from data kindly provided by the Ethiopic Manuscript Imaging Project directed by Steve Delamarter.

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary: Images 3r: Geneology of a family. Images 4r-143r: Psalter. The midpoint of the Psalms is unmarked. Psalm 151 is the short version. Song of Songs is the common edition. Praises of Mary begins on Monday and culminates in Sunday. Image 144r-146r: Instructions about the measurement of shadows for the telling of time for the whole year, ስፍረ፡ ሰዓት።, except for an Asmat Prayer on the top of images 146l. Image 147l, top, contains a record dated 1910 EC and which something was sold by መምሬ ይርጋ ላቀ to መም[ሬ] ተክለ ሥላሴ. Witnesses are listed. Image 147l, bottom, contains the record of a transaction that mentions King Haile Selassie (1930-1974) and to which the party has set a fingerprint with the name written around it, አይችሉሼም ብርሃነ መስቀል. The harags are the distinctive work of the Menilek or Selassie scriptoria.

revisionDesc.change: Created XML record from EMIP Collection Metadata.xsls
